Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with part of floral motif in added white above added white and red bands; exterior: possible hindquarters, with red patch, of animal, perhaps a hound; below, double guilloche pattern in handle zone; below, red strokes above a glazed area.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 264, no. 562)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0634) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
